#summary How to assemble the RCShield.

This is a description of the assembly steps required to get to the final "local part" of the block diagram.<br>
<a href="http://ardurct.googlecode.com/svn/images/RCShield_assembly_2.jpg">
<img src="http://ardurct.googlecode.com/svn/images/RCShield_assembly_2.jpg" width="350"><a>
<a href="http://ardurct.googlecode.com/svn/images/RCShield_assembly_3.jpg">
<img src="http://ardurct.googlecode.com/svn/images/RCShield_assembly_3.jpg" width="350"><a><br>
1/ Cut the 2 boards along the dash lines, making a left and a right part. Cut the small part at the top left of each board, thsese will allow us to assemble the boards together. One of the 2 small boards has to be cut again.<br>

<a href="http://ardurct.googlecode.com/svn/images/RCShield_assembly_4.jpg">
<img src="http://ardurct.googlecode.com/svn/images/RCShield_assembly_4.jpg" width="350"><a>
<a href="http://ardurct.googlecode.com/svn/images/RCShield_assembly_5.jpg">
<img src="http://ardurct.googlecode.com/svn/images/RCShield_assembly_5.jpg" width="350"><a><br>
2/ Solder pins on the 2 smaller boards<br>
3/ Then solder the small boards to the big ones, following the lettering on the boards.

<a href="http://ardurct.googlecode.com/svn/images/RCShield_assembly_6.jpg">
<img src="http://ardurct.googlecode.com/svn/images/RCShield_assembly_6.jpg" width="350"><a>
<a href="http://ardurct.googlecode.com/svn/images/RCShield_assembly_7.jpg">
<img src="http://ardurct.googlecode.com/svn/images/RCShield_assembly_7.jpg" width="350"><a><br>
4/ Solder the SMS components on the board. Follow the desoltering wick method for the FT232 as the pins are pretty near!<br>
5/ Then solder the female headers and the on-off button. Don't forget to solder special extra long pins headers if you want to put your Arduino under the RCShield.

<a href="http://ardurct.googlecode.com/svn/images/RCShield_assembly_8.jpg">
<img src="http://ardurct.googlecode.com/svn/images/RCShield_assembly_8.jpg" width="350"><a>
<a href="http://ardurct.googlecode.com/svn/images/RCShield_assembly_9.jpg">
<img src="http://ardurct.googlecode.com/svn/images/RCShield_assembly_9.jpg" width="350"><a><br>
6/ Solder the joysticks and the potentiometer if you need it.<br>
7/ You can now plug your XBee module and your TouScruino, or your Arduino board.
